trans-unit.source: Column mapping with translator rules
trans-unit.target: Column mapping with translator rules

trans-unit.source: Column mapping can be used to specify how columns specified in the “structure” of source table map to columns specified in the “structure” of sink table.
trans-unit.target: Column mapping can be used to specify how columns specified in the “structure” of source table map to columns specified in the “structure” of sink table.

trans-unit.source: The **columnMapping** property is available in the **typeProperties** section of the Copy activity.
trans-unit.target: The **columnMapping** property is available in the **typeProperties** section of the Copy activity.

trans-unit.source: Column mapping supports the following scenarios:
trans-unit.target: Column mapping supports the following scenarios:

trans-unit.source: All columns in the source table “structure” are mapped to all columns in the sink table “structure”.
trans-unit.target: All columns in the source table “structure” are mapped to all columns in the sink table “structure”.

trans-unit.source: A subset of the columns in the source table “structure” are mapped to all columns in the sink table “structure”.
trans-unit.target: A subset of the columns in the source table “structure” are mapped to all columns in the sink table “structure”.

trans-unit.source: The following are error conditions and will result in an exception:
trans-unit.target: The following are error conditions and will result in an exception:

trans-unit.source: Either fewer columns or more columns in the “structure” of sink table than specified in the mapping.
trans-unit.target: Either fewer columns or more columns in the “structure” of sink table than specified in the mapping.

trans-unit.source: Duplicate mapping.
trans-unit.target: Duplicate mapping.

trans-unit.source: SQL query result does not have a column name that is specified in the mapping.
trans-unit.target: SQL query result does not have a column name that is specified in the mapping.

trans-unit.source: Column mapping samples
trans-unit.target: Column mapping samples

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] The samples below are for Azure SQL and Azure Blob but are applicable in the same way for any data store that supports rectangular tables.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] The samples below are for Azure SQL and Azure Blob but are applicable in the same way for any data store that supports rectangular tables.

trans-unit.source: You will have to adjust dataset and linked service definitions in examples below to point to data in the relevant data source.
trans-unit.target: You will have to adjust dataset and linked service definitions in examples below to point to data in the relevant data source.

trans-unit.source: Sample 1 – column mapping from Azure SQL to Azure blob
trans-unit.target: Sample 1 – column mapping from Azure SQL to Azure blob

trans-unit.source: In this sample, the input table has a structure and it points to a SQL table in an Azure SQL database.
trans-unit.target: In this sample, the input table has a structure and it points to a SQL table in an Azure SQL database.

trans-unit.source: In this sample, the output table has a structure and it points to a blob in an Azure blob storage.
trans-unit.target: In this sample, the output table has a structure and it points to a blob in an Azure blob storage.

trans-unit.source: The JSON for the activity is shown below.
trans-unit.target: The JSON for the activity is shown below.

trans-unit.source: The columns from source mapped to columns in sink (**columnMappings**) by using **Translator** property.
trans-unit.target: The columns from source mapped to columns in sink (**columnMappings**) by using **Translator** property.

trans-unit.source: Column mapping flow:
trans-unit.target: Column mapping flow:

trans-unit.source: Column mapping flow
trans-unit.target: Column mapping flow

trans-unit.source: Sample 2 – column mapping with SQL query from Azure SQL to Azure blob
trans-unit.target: Sample 2 – column mapping with SQL query from Azure SQL to Azure blob

trans-unit.source: In this sample, a SQL query is used to extract data from Azure SQL instead of simply specifying the table name and the column names in “structure” section.
trans-unit.target: In this sample, a SQL query is used to extract data from Azure SQL instead of simply specifying the table name and the column names in “structure” section.

trans-unit.source: In this case, the query results are first mapped to columns specified in “structure” of source.
trans-unit.target: In this case, the query results are first mapped to columns specified in “structure” of source.

trans-unit.source: Next, the columns from source “structure” are mapped to columns in sink “structure” with rules specified in columnMappings.
trans-unit.target: Next, the columns from source “structure” are mapped to columns in sink “structure” with rules specified in columnMappings.

trans-unit.source: Suppose the query returns 5 columns, two additional columns then those specified in the “structure” of source.
trans-unit.target: Suppose the query returns 5 columns, two additional columns then those specified in the “structure” of source.

trans-unit.target: Column mapping flow
